ru.myx.ae3.binary

Interface TransferSource

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TransferCollector

    public interface TransferSource
    Source is a type for an object whose task is to provide some number of bytes. In general, the exact amount of data in source is unknown thus source can be infinite.

    There are two ways to perform non-blocking tasks with a source:
    - isReady(), isComplete(), isExhausted and nextXXX() methods provide generic API.
    - connectTarget() method allows you to pass all exhaustion/absorption process to a source, witch MAY be able to do its job effectively.

    In some cases source can back an immediately available number of bytes whose size is known, then nextClonedBuffer() and isCloneable() methods can unleash their power to gain fast access to a data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean connectTarget(TransferTarget target)
      Connects a target to this source.

    • Method Detail

      • connectTarget

        boolean connectTarget(TransferTarget target)
               throws IllegalStateException
        Connects a target to this source. This method returns immediately. All data that becomes available in this source will be passed to a TransferTarget instance passed to this method. Target will be closed when this source is exhausted. Target will remain connected till this source is exhausted or target will indicate no more interest via false result of one of absorption method calls. Throws IllegalStateException if this source already has a target connected to it. Connection will be canceled by passing null target at any time.
        Parameters:
        target -
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException
